abstracts.cdata!:
Project outcome is rated unsatisfactory:
            the macroeconomic fundamentals of Ghana have been
            deteriorating since the credit was approved, and it is
            likely that this has resulted in changed perceptions and
            priorities and affected project outcome. The project is
            unlikely to be sustained because the institutional and
            regulatory environment has not changed sufficiently. Overall
            World Bank performance is rated unsatisfactory on the basis
            of project design, implementation structure, and the lack of
            private sector involvement. The overall Borrower performance
            is rated unsatisfactory due to the apparent lack of
            commitment by the government and the limited involvement of
            the ultimate beneficiaries. Key lessons learned pertain to
            the importance of involving the private sector in project
            design and implementation; defining the appropriate roles
            for government and the private sector; clarifying
            objectives; obtaining government commitment to comprehensive
            public sector reform; and of acquiring the commitment of all
            the parties to the project in general.

18154861.theme: Technology diffusion,Export development and competitiveness,Other financial and private sector development,Micro, Small and Medium Enterprise support
18154861.trustfund: TF033897-GHANA - PRIVATE SECTOR DEV.,TF021347-PRIVATE SECTOR DEVELOPMENT PROJECT,TF025166-PHRD-INDUSTRIAL INFRASTRUCTURE PROJECT
18154861.majtheme: Trade and integration,Financial and private sector development

abstracts.cdata!:
The Private Sector Development Project
            will foster the development of a competitive private sector
            by: a) assisting the Government in building on its
            investment liberalization by supporting its efforts to
            restructure, reform and commercialize its technical research
            and development establishment along competitive and demand
            driven principles; b) providing to a broad segment of the
            private sector the necessary financial and technial
            assistance to support the development of commercially
            bankable projects by improving their feasiblity and quality;
            c) supporting efforts by the export industry to improve
            their design and the promotion of their products; and d)
            assisting the Government in developing a program to upgrade
            the delivery of legal services to the commercial and
            manufacturing sectors. The project includes the following
            components: 1) technical assistance and training to the
            Secretariat of Ghana's Council for Scientific and
            Industrial Research and four institutes; 2) technology and
            enterprises development fund to assist on a pilot basis
            private small- and medium-size enterprises in increasing
            their efficiency to develop value-added products and provide
            reliable services, developing their technical and financial
            plans; 3) funding for market studies and surveys to
            determine market demand for a trade promotion facility; and
            4) a feasibility and market study to determine the scope,
            financial viability, commercial demand and structure of an
            industrial design center.
